## Data

For this analysis we'll use the `penguins` dataset from the [**palmerpenguins**](https://allisonhorst.github.io/palmerpenguins/) package [@gorman2014].

```{python}
#| label: load-packages
#| message: false

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

penguins = sns.load_dataset("penguins")
```

## Species

@fig-bills-dims-species is a scatterplot plot of species of penguins.

```{python}
#| label: fig-bills-dims-species
#| fig-cap: "A scatterplot of three species of penguins showing the relationship between bill depth and bill length."
#| fig-width: 5
#| fig-asp: 0.618
#| warning: false
sns.scatterplot(data=penguins, x="bill_length_mm",
  y="bill_depth_mm", hue="species", style="species", palette="colorblind")
plt.xlabel("Bill length (mm)")
plt.ylabel("Bill depth (mm)")
plt.show()
```

## Penguins

@tbl-penguins-top10 shows the first 10 penguins from the dataset.

```{python}
#| label: tbl-penguins-top10
#| tbl-cap: These are the first 10 penguins in the data.
#| tbl-cap-location: bottom
penguins.head(10)[['species', 'island', 'bill_length_mm',
```
